title: How to Make Chinese Sweet Steamed Egg Pudding

steps.headline: Add water and sugar to a pot.
steps.description: Turn on the heat and warm the water just enough to completely dissolve the sugar. Do not let it boil or get too hot; when adding the eggs later, you don't accidentally want to cook the eggs prematurely!

steps.headline: Turn off the heat and immediately add the milk.
steps.description: Set aside to let the mixture cool.

steps.headline: Beat the eggs in a separate bowl with a fork.
steps.description: Beat them just enough to mix the yolk and white, and don't overbeat.

steps.headline: Add the milk and sugar mixture to the beaten eggs.
steps.description: Mix just enough to incorporate the ingredients well.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture through a sieve into individual bowls that are safe for steaming.
steps.description: The sieve will remove any lumps or bubbles to create a smooth product.

steps.headline: Cover the bowls with foil, plastic wrap, or a cloth.
steps.description: This will prevent the moisture from steaming from dripping into the pudding and making it watery. Even one hole in the coverings can let in moisture, so cover them tightly!

steps.headline: Steam the bowls.
steps.description: Boil the water in the steamer and place the bowls inside for 12 minutes under medium heat.

steps.headline: Serve or refrigerate before serving!
steps.description: To create a firmer texture, refrigerate until fully chilled. You can also let this cool a bit and serve warm. This is traditionally eaten by itself to preserve the delicate flavor, but you can add toppings such as fresh fruit if you wish. The bowls right after steaming will be very hot, so be careful.
